img_above_text:
![Wukong Sandgate 56.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/1/1b/Wukong_Sandgate_56.jpg)
Sometimes, he’ll even rear back for a quick headbutt slam, but the move will usually stagger himself, and a quick dodge will give you a lot of time to lay into him.
img_below_text:
It’s when you kill the King that you’ll really have to start worrying. He’ll power up with blasts of wind as his mace glows hot, and will now imbue his strikes with fissures that erupt all around the impact site of his weapon!
![Wukong Sandgate 58.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/1/18/Wukong_Sandgate_58.jpg)

img_summary: The image depicts a combat scene from *Black Myth: Wukong*, showcasing the player character engaging in a fight against the "Second Rat Prince," as indicated by the health bar and name. The environment is a desolate, sandy battlefield with scattered debris and ominous trees in the background. The preceding text mentions the enemy's headbutt slam attack, which can stagger itself, while the following text warns of the King powering up with wind blasts and fissures after being defeated. This image likely illustrates the ongoing battle with the Second Rat Prince before the King becomes a greater threat.
